note:
This group aims to be network for disabled and/or chronically ill persons (especially people negatively affected by the ongoing pandemic), and their partners, a place where communal care can be discussed and examined from an anarchistic/feminist viewpoint, but also a place to put it into practice.
Patriarchy kills
Ableism isolates and kills
Anti-capitalist
Intersectional

Join us to create zines, collections of art about covid, the pandemic & the collective abandonment of disabled people

Bureacracy is my kryptonite.

Editor: What do we do about inequality? & What do we do after the pandemic?

note:
Disabled & chronically ill writer. Former theatre critic. Passionate about disability rights, clean air, masks and covid caution. Clean air is a human right & masks work.

I write about the experience of being highly vulnerable during a pandemic, isolation, loss of healthcare and euthanasia. My focus is on how we can find support, fight back & create better systems and safety nets everyone.

#CovidisAirborne #Disability #Pandemic #MasksWork #CleanAir #Ableism #ChronicIllness #CovidIsNotOver

note:
Features editor at Dark Reading (currently on medical leave). Full of love, fear, and carbs. Trans rights are human rights. Header image is a closeup of Nibbler, a fuzzy brown tabby, sitting on my chest in bed; avatar is a selfie of me, a smiling white woman in a yellow cardigan, lying in bed with Nibbler's striped tail wrapping around my face. #journalism #journalist #DarkReading #disability

Most posts auto-delete after 3 months, so grab that meme when you see it! :)
